page.title: 06SHROTON BUILDINGS:CHURCH
page.content: THE MOST IMPRESSIVE BUILDING IS THE {CHURCH}IN ITS PEACEFUL WELL-KEPT CHURCHYARD. THE RIVER USED TO FLOW BESIDE THE ROAD BUT IS NOW DIVERTED. THE LIST OF RECTORS GOES BACK TO THE 13TH CENT. BUT THE OLDEST PART OF THE CHURCH IS THE 14TH CENT. TOWER WITH ITS SIX BELLS. THE REST WAS REBUILT AFTER A FIRE IN 1610. IT IS SIMPLE AND IN A TRADITIONAL MEDIEVAL STYLE AND SHAPE. THERE IS A LARGE MEMORIAL TO THE FREKE FAMILY IN THE CHAPEL IN THE NORTH AISLE. THEY REBUILT THE CHURCH BUT HAVE NOW DIED OUT AND THEIR MANOR HOUSE IS RUINED. NEXT TO THE CHURCH IS A GROUP OF THATCHED FARM BUILDINGS INCLUDING AN{ELIZABETHAN TITHE BARN,}A {WAGONSHED}AND THE REMAINS OF A {DOVECOTE.}THE FARMER FINDS THEM A BIND AS HE IS NOT ALLOWED TO MODERNISE THEM. AT THE OTHER END OF THE VILLAGE THERE IS A 19TH CENT.{METHODIST CHAPEL
